intro: Psychotria parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant features small, dark green leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature. Psychotria parvifolia is often found in understory habitats of tropical forests and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
